Governor: What a lovely occasion... It's always a joy to visit Stardew Valley.#$e#I must speak to the missus about purchasing a vacation home here.
Abigail_spouse: I can't wait to try the pie! We brought something good, I hope.
Leah_spouse: I never had many friends in town, so these events are always kind of boring for me. I enjoy the buffet, though.
Maru_spouse: I'm just catching up with Penny. Have you had your fill of sweet potatoes yet?
Penny_spouse: Maru's trying to convince me to eat some of the sweet potato pie. I'm just not sure if I am allowed before the governor...
Haley_spouse: I was going to eat some pie, but then I remembered I'm on a spring diet.
Sebastian_spouse: Do you know where the giant potato came from?$h
Sam_spouse: The gang's just the same as always. Are you having a good time?
Alex_spouse: Ungh... I think I ate a dozen too many sweet potatoes...$s
Elliott_spouse: I enjoy seeing you so relaxed, my dear.$h
Wiggles_spouse: Can't wait to try all of the potatoes.
Krobus_spouse: I'm not brave enough today to talk to the others.
Abigail: The first batch of pie smells delicious$h
Robin: Spring is a busy time of year... so it's nice to have a day off to catch up with friends.
Demetrius: Sweet potato... what a strange thing to eat.
Maru: I always look forward to these gatherings... it makes the valley feel like a real community.
Sebastian: How can I try some of the pie now without anyone noticing?
Linus: No one really talks to me... I just come for the delicious food.
Pierre: The things people bring for the pie look all good to me. Just making sure!
Caroline: My ex husband can't stop thinking about produce and profit. Not even on his day off.
Alex: I try to eat at least three sweet potatoes every day.#$e#It is great for your health.
George: What's everyone so happy about? Hmmph...#$b#Sweet potatoes... why sweet potatoes?
Evelyn: I hope this becomes a new tradition.#$b#Tradition connects us with both the past and the future... it's comforting.
Clint: Why am I here and not at the food table?
Penny: The children are so excited about this strange giant sweet potato and are debating about its origin.
Pam: Hehe... I put something strong into the punch.$h#$e#Shhh... that's just as always between you and me, kid.
Emily: I've been up since dawn making decorations... it's always my favorite part of every festival besides the good tunes.$h
Haley: This festival is alright... but what I'm really looking forward to is the new followers I will get after my selfie with the potato goes viral.
Jodi: Vincent loves sweet potatoes... it's a joy to see him so happy.
Kent: I'm not a big fan of sweet potatoes, to tell you the truth.
Marlon: Even with my bad leg, I never miss a town festival.
Leah: Mmmm... This fruit punch is unusually punchy.$h
Shane: Oscar, Bobby and the Octochef have been working overtime to prepare for this festival.#$b#They deserve a nice break afterwards!$h
Marnie: Welcome to the Sweet Potato Palooza... complements of our head chef.
Elliott: I hope to find new inspiration here at the palooza.
Gus: I hope everyone's enjoying the food... I've been cooking day and night with the head chef of Oscar's hotel to get everything ready.#$b# Baked sweet potato, sweet potato fries, sweet potato curry, sweet potato soup,... you name it!$h
Wizard: Hmm... I wonder who through the sweet potato down to earth.
Harvey: How is everyone doing? I'm just taking a break for a little while. I'm looking forward to the pie testing!
Jas: How fun to see this giant potato up close!
Vincent: How can I get out of here? I want to the giant potato!
Willy: What a weird thing to fall down from the sky. Makes you wonder what es is up there. Possibly as much secrets as deep down in the ocean!
Dobson: What a weird occasion. A giant sweet potato fell from the sky and no one questions it?
Krobus: I was too curious about the loud noise but am too scared of rejection to go further.
